prompts.proposer: Call proposer_brief_tool() FIRST. Then select candidates by name and choose a score_preset. Return ONLY JSON per instructions. IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY reference candidate names that appear in the tool output candidate_library; unknown names will hard-stop.
prompts.skeptic:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35"]
prompts.statistician:
Chame build_debate_packet_tool() PRIMEIRO (inputs via context). Depois retorne APENAS JSON (sem markdown) com add_names, remove_names, params_overrides, rationale, changes, when_good.
IMPORTANT: you MUST ONLY use candidate names from valid_candidate_names; unknown names hard-stop.
You may only remove/override candidates that are in current_candidate_names (or candidates you are adding).
valid_candidate_names: ["baseline_mean", "best_per_horizon_by_validation", "best_single_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k10_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k2_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k3_sh0.50", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.00", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.15", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.25", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.30", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.50", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l2100_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l220_topk5", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk3", "ridge_stacking_l250_topk5", "robust_median", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k10", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k2", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k3", "topk_mean_per_horizon_k5", "trimmed_mean_r0.05", "trimmed_mean_r0.10", "trimmed_mean_r0.20", "trimmed_mean_r0.30"]
current_candidate_names: ["best_per_horizon_by_validation", "inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35", "trimmed_mean_r0.20"]

proposer.rationale: High model disagreement (relative spread mean 0.378) and heterogeneous horizon performance justify robust methods. Baseline_mean provides stability, best_per_horizon_by_validation adapts to horizon-specific strengths, and inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35 balances model contributions with adjusted shrinkage.

skeptic.rationale: baseline_mean shows unstable performance (RMSE_std_over_RMSE=49.7%) and lags behind best_per_horizon_by_validation (score 0.966 vs 0.930). Trimmed_mean_r0.20 (RMSE=1283.05) offers better stability than current candidates. Parameter adjustments align with recommendations for few-window scenarios (trim_ratio=0.2, l2=50, shrinkage=0.35).

changes.name: trimmed_mean_r0.20
changes.reason: better stability (RMSE=1283.05) compared to current candidates

changes.name: best_per_horizon_by_validation
changes.reason: recommended l2 regularization for few-window scenarios

skeptic.when_good: when few-window scenarios require stronger regularization and stability

statistician.rationale: With n_windows=3, stronger regularization is needed. Added ridge_stacking_l250_topk5 (matches recommended l2=50, topk=5) and robust_median (stable baseline). Removed best_per_horizon_by_validation (lower stability). Overrode l2 for inverse_rmse_weights_k5_sh0.35 and shrinkage for trimmed_mean_r0.20 to align with recommended knobs.

changes.name: ridge_stacking_l250_topk5
changes.reason: Matches recommended l2=50 and topk=5 for small n_windows

changes.name: robust_median
changes.reason: Provides stable baseline with low RMSE_std

changes.name: best_per_horizon_by_validation
changes.reason: Lower stability (RMSE_std=637) compared to added candidates

statistician.when_good: When n_windows is small (3) and stability is critical
